text: Martin Eden is a 2019 Italian-French historical romance drama film directed by Pietro Marcello, loosely based on the 1909 novel of the same name by Jack London. It was selected to compete for the Golden Lion at the 76th Venice International Film Festival. At the Venice Film Festival, Luca Marinelli won the Volpi Cup for Best Actor. ==Cast== ==Production== Principal photography for the film began in May 2018 in Naples, Italy. ==Release== The film had its world premiere at the Venice International Film Festival on 2 September 2019. It was screened at the 2019 Toronto International Film Festival in the Platform Prize program,"TIFF 2019: Platform lineup includes films by Julie Delpy, Sarah Gavron". Now, 7 August 2019. and was announced as the winner of the Platform Prize on 12 September. It was released in Italy by 01 Distribution on 4 September 2019. It will be released in France by Shellac Distribution on 16 October 2019. ==Response== ===Box office=== Martin Eden grossed $0 in North America and $2.8 million in other territories. ===Critical reception=== On review aggregator Rotten Tomatoes, the film holds an approval rating of 85% based on 46 reviews, with an average rating of 7.42/10. On Metacritic, the film holds a rating of 57 out of 100, based on 6 critics, indicating "mixed or average reviews". ==References== ==External links== * * * Category:2019 films Category:2019 drama films Category:2010s historical romance films Category:2019 romantic drama films Category:French romantic drama films Category:French historical romance films Category:French films Category:Italian romantic drama films Category:Italian films Category:Italian- language films Category:Italian historical romance films Category:Films about interclass romance Category:Films about social class Category:Films about writers Category:Films based on works by Jack London Category:Films set in the 1900s Category:Films set in Naples Category:Films shot in Naples Category:Films based on American novels Category:Films directed by Pietro Marcello
title: Martin Eden (2019 film)
